title: Is Coulomb force a central or electric force? - Quora

response.answer_text: Um, electric? Coulomb force is another name for electrostatic force; they’re the same thing. I’m not sure what you mean by central force, but if it means what I think it means then yes, it is also a central force. It was designed to work with point charges. To be fair, using calculus, you can also use it for continuous charge distributions (charge stuff… gooey charge… I don’t know how to describe it; painted charge… I hope you get it), while it was theoretically formed considering discrete charge distributions (point charges). For continuous charge distributions, you don’t really think about “centers” of the charge unless using very special shapes; it’s better practice to think about the big picture: all of the charge together, rather than individual charges in distinct locations, or points. Hope this helps.
